name: Residenza Torre Colonna

reviews.text: After walking per hours in rome, what a lovely feeling knowing you are back into a special place. Well, that's the feeling i had staying in this beautiful and sophisticated small hotel. A medieval tower in the center of the city, five rooms, one in each floor. The small and chic lobby welcomes you into a perfect combination of antique and modern... modern design lamps, colorfull and vibrating paintings created specially for the hotel by Natino Chirico. There s a terrace with a 360 degree spectacular view of rome and a pompeyan red breakfast room.
reviews.title: Un petit bijou

reviews.text: The room was absolutely perfect... every detail has been taken care, from the linen to the towels, confortable bed, beautiful and impecable bathroom, satelite tv, computer connection, the furniture of the room, as well as the whole hotel s furtniture, has been designed by the owner . The breakfast which is included, is at the highest level, don t forget to try the very special tray of cheeses, jams and marmelades come from the family s agroturismo, all served impecably.
reviews.title: A unique atmosphere

reviews.text: At last but not least the fact that the owner takes care personally of your arriving and leaving, makes you feel that nothing can go wrong in your staying in rome!!!!!
reviews.title: Not to be missed

reviews.text: A unique blend of medieval architecture and modern art, Residenza Torre Colonna offers a quiet and luxurious accomodation in the heart of Rome (albeit for the selected few - there are just five rooms), a breathtaking view from its rooftop terrace, an abundant and excellent breakfast and the nice hospitality of its owners. Great!
reviews.title: Place was beautiful, original, and the staff could not be more generous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and our two kids (8 & 10) stayed a weekend at the Torre Colonna on the way to Puglia and again on the way back again. The Torre is medieval but has been recently renovated in a very hip design style while retaining the solid timber ceilings. It was really the highlight of our trip to Italy: breakfast with beautiful Northern Italy cheeses and different local pastries, wonderfully attentive service and the ability to sit in the hot pool on the roof terrace and overlook Imperial Rome. But the Torre is not for people who want the trappings of a large business hotel - it is very firmly in the boutique and personal space with much personality.
reviews.title: Amazing experience in Torre Colonna

reviews.text: Torre Colonna has the "WOW" factor. The pictures are accurate - mine was the yellow one pictured on the website. Each floor of this restored and updated old tower is a tasteful small suite. My colorful one had a walk-in closet and a very spacious, fully equipped bathroom with hydromassage tub. The sleeping area wasn't particularly large, but the walls in the room and throughout the tower were covered with original modern art. The bed was perfectly comfortable after a long day of walking. Although Torre Colonna is on a busy street, the windows are double-glazed and the room was quite quiet. An included continental breakfast is offered on the top (6th) floor. Free high speed internet is via ethernet cable only - they will provide one for you if don't have one. The staff is minimal, so this accomodation really is for those who don't mind self-sufficiency. It is not an overly expensive place for Rome. Of course, you can find cheaper and maybe/maybe not more spacious, but not such a unique residence with a wonderful, intimate one-of-a-kind designer appeal and perfect location at the very edge of the ancient ruins. From the roof terrace, you realize how compact historical Rome is because you can see the Colosseum, the Palatine, Vittorio Emmanuele, Trajan's Column (literally around the corner), the top of the Pantheon, and St. Peter's. To get there, take the #64 bus from Termini to Piazza Venezia (major transfer point) for 1 euro and walk back up the route around the corner 2 or 3 blocks (under 5 minutes). Avoid taxis at Termini at all costs - it's a 10 minute ride at worst. If you have lots of luggage and you must use one, if someone gives you a song and dance about not using the meter for whatever reason (it's all dishonest BS), move on to another taxi and also threaten to call the Tourist Police. The maximum fare should not be more than 15 euros.
reviews.title: I should probably keep this place to myself :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want somewhere small, individual and unique to stay in Rome, try the Torre Colonna. Set in a Medieval tower the 5 rooms are spacious, the bathrooms large and luxurious (ours had twin sinks and a sunken hydro massage shower) and we even had a small room for bags, the fridge and safe. Unusual for city centre accommodation this generous space is achieved because there is only one room per floor. The rooms are decorated in a mixture of old and modern - we particularly liked the local artist's modern art that was displayed throughout the building.
reviews.title: A gem of a place to stay in Rome

reviews.text: Breakfast is served on the 6th floor - don't worry, there is a lift! The range of food on offer was impressive - freshly squeezed orange juice, coffee made to order, a wide variety of teas, a selection of fresh local breads and cakes, jams, Italian cheeses and salami, fresh fruit.......all served in the 'red room' also furnished with leather sofas so you can read the papers. reviews.text: a hot tub and spectacular views over Rome.
reviews.title: Magnificent! One of the most memorable places we have ever stayed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner came and chatted to us at breakfast each day, the other member of staff was equally friendly.
reviews.title: What a Marvelous villa

description: Each room has a Nespresso machine, a kettle with a selection of fine teas, a touch screen computer, a safe, a minibar and hairdryer in the bathroom. All our rooms have 2 sets of double glazing and air conditioning/heating. We also have a jacuzzi tub on the roof terrace overlooking the Roman Forum, which is free and open 24/7. Our breakfast,(with freshly squeezed orange juice) is very abundant and has become quite famous! All our rooms are stricktly no smoking however smoking is permitted on the roof terrace. Wi-fi is free of charge.
